#!/bin/bash
# Configuration and constants for system monitoring

# System thresholds
readonly CPU_WARNING_THRESHOLD=70
readonly CPU_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD=90
readonly MEMORY_WARNING_THRESHOLD=80
readonly MEMORY_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD=95
readonly DISK_WARNING_THRESHOLD=85
readonly DISK_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD=95

# Monitoring intervals (in seconds)
readonly DEFAULT_INTERVAL=5
readonly MIN_INTERVAL=1
readonly MAX_INTERVAL=3600

# Report settings
readonly REPORT_DIR="/tmp/system_monitor_reports"
readonly REPORT_PREFIX="system_report"
readonly MAX_REPORT_AGE_DAYS=7

# Process monitoring settings
readonly TOP_PROCESSES_COUNT=10
readonly PROCESS_NAME_MAX_LENGTH=50

# Network monitoring settings
readonly NETWORK_INTERFACES=("eth0" "lo" "wlan0" "docker0")
readonly NETWORK_STATS_FIELDS=("rx_bytes" "tx_bytes" "rx_packets" "tx_packets")

# Declare associative arrays for service configurations
declare -A SERVICE_PORTS=(
    ["ssh"]=22
    ["http"]=80
    ["https"]=443
    ["mysql"]=3306
    ["postgresql"]=5432
    ["redis"]=6379
)

declare -A SERVICE_NAMES=(
    [22]="SSH"
    [80]="HTTP"
    [443]="HTTPS"
    [3306]="MySQL"
    [5432]="PostgreSQL"
    [6379]="Redis"
)

# Alert configurations
declare -A ALERT_LEVELS=(
    ["info"]=0
    ["warning"]=1
    ["critical"]=2
    ["fatal"]=3
)

# System paths
readonly PROC_STAT="/proc/stat"
readonly PROC_MEMINFO="/proc/meminfo"
readonly PROC_LOADAVG="/proc/loadavg"
readonly PROC_NET_DEV="/proc/net/dev"
readonly PROC_UPTIME="/proc/uptime"

# Output formats
readonly OUTPUT_FORMAT_JSON="json"
readonly OUTPUT_FORMAT_TEXT="text"
readonly OUTPUT_FORMAT_CSV="csv"
readonly DEFAULT_OUTPUT_FORMAT="text"

# Feature flags
readonly ENABLE_CPU_MONITORING=true
readonly ENABLE_MEMORY_MONITORING=true
readonly ENABLE_DISK_MONITORING=true
readonly ENABLE_NETWORK_MONITORING=true
readonly ENABLE_PROCESS_MONITORING=true
readonly ENABLE_SERVICE_MONITORING=true

# Export configuration validation function
validate_config() {
    local errors=0
    
    # Check if required directories exist or can be created
    if ! mkdir -p "$REPORT_DIR" 2>/dev/null; then
        echo "ERROR: Cannot create report directory: $REPORT_DIR" >&2
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    # Validate thresholds
    if (( CPU_WARNING_THRESHOLD >= CPU_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD )); then
        echo "ERROR: CPU warning threshold must be less than critical threshold" >&2
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if (( MEMORY_WARNING_THRESHOLD >= MEMORY_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD )); then
        echo "ERROR: Memory warning threshold must be less than critical threshold" >&2
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if (( DISK_WARNING_THRESHOLD >= DISK_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD )); then
        echo "ERROR: Disk warning threshold must be less than critical threshold" >&2
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    return $errors
}

echo "âœ“ config/settings.sh validated and saved"

#!/bin/bash
# File service functions for report management

# Source dependencies
source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/../lib/utils.sh" 2>/dev/null || {
    echo "ERROR: Cannot source utils.sh" >&2
    exit 1
}

source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/../config/settings.sh" 2>/dev/null || {
    echo "ERROR: Cannot source settings.sh" >&2
    exit 1
}

# Generate report filename
generate_report_filename() {
    local format="${1:-$DEFAULT_OUTPUT_FORMAT}"
    local timestamp=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
    echo "${REPORT_DIR}/${REPORT_PREFIX}_${timestamp}.${format}"
}

# Write report header
write_report_header() {
    local file="$1"
    local format="$2"
    
    case "$format" in
        "json")
            echo '{' > "$file"
            echo '  "metadata": {' >> "$file"
            echo "    \"timestamp\": \"$(date -Iseconds)\"," >> "$file"
            echo "    \"hostname\": \"$(hostname)\"," >> "$file"
            echo "    \"kernel\": \"$(uname -r)\"" >> "$file"
            echo '  },' >> "$file"
            echo '  "data": {' >> "$file"
            ;;
        "csv")
            echo "timestamp,metric,value,unit,status" > "$file"
            ;;
        "text")
            echo "=== SYSTEM MONITORING REPORT ===" > "$file"
            echo "Generated: $(date)" >> "$file"
            echo "Hostname: $(hostname)" >> "$file"
            echo "Kernel: $(uname -r)" >> "$file"
            echo "================================" >> "$file"
            echo >> "$file"
            ;;
    esac
}

# Write report footer
write_report_footer() {
    local file="$1"
    local format="$2"
    
    case "$format" in
        "json")
            # Remove trailing comma from last entry
            sed -i '$ s/,$//' "$file"
            echo '  }' >> "$file"
            echo '}' >> "$file"
            ;;
        "text")
            echo >> "$file"
            echo "================================" >> "$file"
            echo "Report completed: $(date)" >> "$file"
            ;;
    esac
}

# Append data to report
append_to_report() {
    local file="$1"
    local format="$2"
    local metric="$3"
    local value="$4"
    local unit="$5"
    local status="$6"
    
    case "$format" in
        "json")
            echo "    \"$metric\": {" >> "$file"
            echo "      \"value\": $value," >> "$file"
            echo "      \"unit\": \"$unit\"," >> "$file"
            echo "      \"status\": \"$status\"" >> "$file"
            echo "    }," >> "$file"
            ;;
        "csv")
            echo "$(date -Iseconds),$metric,$value,$unit,$status" >> "$file"
            ;;
        "text")
            printf "%-30s: %10s %-10s [%s]\n" "$metric" "$value" "$unit" "$status" >> "$file"
            ;;
    esac
}

# Clean old reports
clean_old_reports() {
    local max_age_days="${1:-$MAX_REPORT_AGE_DAYS}"
    local count=0
    
    log_info "Cleaning reports older than $max_age_days days"
    
    if [[ -d "$REPORT_DIR" ]]; then
        while IFS= read -r file; do
            rm -f "$file"
            ((count++))
        done < <(find "$REPORT_DIR" -name "${REPORT_PREFIX}_*" -type f -mtime +"$max_age_days")
        
        if (( count > 0 )); then
            log_success "Removed $count old report(s)"
        else
            log_info "No old reports to clean"
        fi
    fi
}

# List recent reports
list_reports() {
    local limit="${1:-10}"
    
    if [[ -d "$REPORT_DIR" ]]; then
        echo "Recent reports (latest $limit):"
        find "$REPORT_DIR" -name "${REPORT_PREFIX}_*" -type f -printf "%T@ %p\n" | \
            sort -nr | \
            head -n "$limit" | \
            while read -r timestamp file; do
                size=$(stat -c "%s" "$file" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
                human_size=$(bytes_to_human "$size")
                mod_time=$(date -d "@${timestamp%.*}" "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
                printf "  %-60s %10s  %s\n" "$(basename "$file")" "$human_size" "$mod_time"
            done
    else
        log_warning "Report directory does not exist: $REPORT_DIR"
    fi
}

# Archive reports
archive_reports() {
    local archive_name="${REPORT_DIR}/archive_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).tar.gz"
    local count=0
    
    if [[ -d "$REPORT_DIR" ]]; then
        # Count files to archive
        count=$(find "$REPORT_DIR" -name "${REPORT_PREFIX}_*" -type f | wc -l)
        
        if (( count > 0 )); then
            log_info "Archiving $count report(s)"
            
            # Create archive
            tar -czf "$archive_name" -C "$REPORT_DIR" \
                $(find "$REPORT_DIR" -name "${REPORT_PREFIX}_*" -type f -printf "%f ")
            
            if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Remove archived files
                find "$REPORT_DIR" -name "${REPORT_PREFIX}_*" -type f -delete
                log_success "Created archive: $archive_name"
            else
                log_error "Failed to create archive"
                return 1
            fi
        else
            log_info "No reports to archive"
        fi
    fi
}

echo "âœ“ services/file_service.sh validated and saved"

#!/bin/bash
# Process monitoring service functions

# Source dependencies
source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/../lib/utils.sh" 2>/dev/null || {
    echo "ERROR: Cannot source utils.sh" >&2
    exit 1
}

source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/../config/settings.sh" 2>/dev/null || {
    echo "ERROR: Cannot source settings.sh" >&2
    exit 1
}

# Get CPU usage percentage
get_cpu_usage() {
    local cpu_line
    local idle_time
    local total_time
    
    # Read CPU stats
    cpu_line=$(head -1 "$PROC_STAT")
    
    # Extract CPU times
    local user=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $2}')
    local nice=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $3}')
    local system=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $4}')
    local idle=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $5}')
    local iowait=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $6}')
    local irq=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $7}')
    local softirq=$(echo "$cpu_line" | awk '{print $8}')
    
    # Calculate total and idle time
    total_time=$((user + nice + system + idle + iowait + irq + softirq))
    idle_time=$idle
    
    # Store for next calculation
    if [[ -n "$PREV_TOTAL_TIME" ]] && [[ -n "$PREV_IDLE_TIME" ]]; then
        local diff_total=$((total_time - PREV_TOTAL_TIME))
        local diff_idle=$((idle_time - PREV_IDLE_TIME))
        
        if (( diff_total > 0 )); then
            local cpu_usage=$(echo "scale=2; 100 * (1 - $diff_idle / $diff_total)" | bc)
            echo "$cpu_usage"
        else
            echo "0.00"
        fi
    else
        echo "0.00"
    fi
    
    # Export for next iteration
    export PREV_TOTAL_TIME=$total_time
    export PREV_IDLE_TIME=$idle_time
}

# Get memory usage information
get_memory_info() {
    local mem_total=$(grep "^MemTotal:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local mem_free=$(grep "^MemFree:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local mem_available=$(grep "^MemAvailable:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local buffers=$(grep "^Buffers:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local cached=$(grep "^Cached:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local swap_total=$(grep "^SwapTotal:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    local swap_free=$(grep "^SwapFree:" "$PROC_MEMINFO" | awk '{print $2}')
    
    # Calculate used memory
    local mem_used=$((mem_total - mem_available))
    local swap_used=$((swap_total - swap_free))
    
    # Calculate percentages
    local mem_percent=$(calculate_percentage "$mem_used" "$mem_total")
    local swap_percent="0.00"
    if (( swap_total > 0 )); then
        swap_percent=$(calculate_percentage "$swap_used" "$swap_total")
    fi
    
    # Return as associative array string
    echo "mem_total=$mem_total"
    echo "mem_used=$mem_used"
    echo "mem_free=$mem_free"
    echo "mem_percent=$mem_percent"
    echo "swap_total=$swap_total"
    echo "swap_used=$swap_used"
    echo "swap_percent=$swap_percent"
}

# Get disk usage for all mounted filesystems
get_disk_usage() {
    df -P | tail -n +2 | while read -r filesystem blocks used available percent mountpoint; do
        # Skip special filesystems
        if [[ "$filesystem" =~ ^(tmpfs|devtmpfs|udev|none)$ ]]; then
            continue
        fi
        
        # Remove % sign from percent
        percent="${percent%\%}"
        
        # Determine status based on threshold
        local status="OK"
        if (( percent >= DISK_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD )); then
            status="CRITICAL"
        elif (( percent >= DISK_WARNING_THRESHOLD )); then
            status="WARNING"
        fi
        
        echo "filesystem=$filesystem"
        echo "mountpoint=$mountpoint"
        echo "total_blocks=$blocks"
        echo "used_blocks=$used"
        echo "available_blocks=$available"
        echo "percent=$percent"
        echo "status=$status"
        echo "---"
    done
}

# Get top processes by CPU usage
get_top_processes_by_cpu() {
    local count="${1:-$TOP_PROCESSES_COUNT}"
    
    ps aux --sort=-%cpu | head -n $((count + 1)) | tail -n +2 | \
    while read -r user pid cpu mem vsz rss tty stat start time command; do
        # Truncate command if too long
        if (( ${#command} > PROCESS_NAME_MAX_LENGTH )); then
            command="${command:0:$((PROCESS_NAME_MAX_LENGTH - 3))}..."
        fi
        
        echo "pid=$pid"
        echo "user=$user"
        echo "cpu=$cpu"
        echo "mem=$mem"
        echo "command=$command"
        echo "---"
    done
}

# Get top processes by memory usage
get_top_processes_by_memory() {
    local count="${1:-$TOP_PROCESSES_COUNT}"
    
    ps aux --sort=-%mem | head -n $((count + 1)) | tail -n +2 | \
    while read -r user pid cpu mem vsz rss tty stat start time command; do
        # Truncate command if too long
        if (( ${#command} > PROCESS_NAME_MAX_LENGTH )); then
            command="${command:0:$((PROCESS_NAME_MAX_LENGTH - 3))}..."
        fi
        
        echo "pid=$pid"
        echo "user=$user"
        echo "cpu=$cpu"
        echo "mem=$mem"
        echo "command=$command"
        echo "---"
    done
}

# Check if a service is running on a port
check_service_port() {
    local port="$1"
    local service_name="${SERVICE_NAMES[$port]:-Unknown}"
    
    # Check if port is listening
    if netstat -tln 2>/dev/null | grep -q ":${port}\s"; then
        echo "port=$port"
        echo "service=$service_name"
        echo "status=LISTENING"
    else
        echo "port=$port"
        echo "service=$service_name"
        echo "status=NOT_LISTENING"
    fi
}

# Get system load average
get_load_average() {
    local load1 load5 load15 running_procs total_procs
    
    read -r load1 load5 load15 running_procs total_procs < "$PROC_LOADAVG"
    
    # Get number of CPUs
    local cpu_count=$(nproc 2>/dev/null || echo "1")
    
    # Calculate normalized load (load per CPU)
    local norm_load1=$(echo "scale=2; $load1 / $cpu_count" | bc)
    local norm_load5=$(echo "scale=2; $load5 / $cpu_count" | bc)
    local norm_load15=$(echo "scale=2; $load15 / $cpu_count" | bc)
    
    echo "load1=$load1"
    echo "load5=$load5"
    echo "load15=$load15"
    echo "norm_load1=$norm_load1"
    echo "norm_load5=$norm_load5"
    echo "norm_load15=$norm_load15"
    echo "cpu_count=$cpu_count"
    echo "running_procs=${running_procs%/*}"
    echo "total_procs=${total_procs}"
}

# Get system uptime
get_system_uptime() {
    local uptime_seconds
    local idle_seconds
    
    read -r uptime_seconds idle_seconds < "$PROC_UPTIME"
    
    # Convert to days, hours, minutes
    local days=$((${uptime_seconds%.*} / 86400))
    local hours=$(( (${uptime_seconds%.*} % 86400) / 3600 ))
    local minutes=$(( (${uptime_seconds%.*} % 3600) / 60 ))
    
    echo "uptime_seconds=${uptime_seconds%.*}"
    echo "uptime_days=$days"
    echo "uptime_hours=$hours"
    echo "uptime_minutes=$minutes"
    echo "uptime_formatted=${days}d ${hours}h ${minutes}m"
}

echo "âœ“ services/process_service.sh validated and saved"

#!/bin/bash
# Main system monitoring and reporting tool

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"

# Source all required files
echo "=== MULTI-FILE BASH SYSTEM MONITOR DEMO ==="
echo
echo "Loading components..."

# Source utilities
if ! source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/utils.sh"; then
    echo "ERROR: Failed to load utils.sh" >&2
    exit 1
fi
log_success "Loaded utility functions"

# Source configuration
if ! source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/config/settings.sh"; then
    log_error "Failed to load settings.sh"
    exit 1
fi
log_success "Loaded configuration"

# Source services
if ! source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/services/file_service.sh"; then
    log_error "Failed to load file_service.sh"
    exit 1
fi
log_success "Loaded file service"

if ! source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/services/process_service.sh"; then
    log_error "Failed to load process_service.sh"
    exit 1
fi
log_success "Loaded process service"

# Set up error handling
set_error_trap
trap cleanup_on_exit EXIT

# Validate configuration
echo
log_info "Validating configuration..."
if ! validate_config; then
    log_error "Configuration validation failed"
    exit 1
fi
log_success "Configuration validated"

# Main monitoring function
run_system_monitor() {
    local output_format="${1:-$DEFAULT_OUTPUT_FORMAT}"
    local report_file
    
    # Generate report filename
    report_file=$(generate_report_filename "$output_format")
    log_info "Creating report: $report_file"
    
    # Ensure report directory exists
    ensure_directory "$REPORT_DIR"
    
    # Write report header
    write_report_header "$report_file" "$output_format"
    
    # CPU Usage
    if [[ "$ENABLE_CPU_MONITORING" == "true" ]]; then
        log_info "Checking CPU usage..."
        local cpu_usage=$(get_cpu_usage)
        sleep 1  # Need a delay for accurate CPU calculation
        cpu_usage=$(get_cpu_usage)
        
        local cpu_status="OK"
        if (( $(echo "$cpu_usage >= $CPU_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD" | bc -l) )); then
            cpu_status="CRITICAL"
        elif (( $(echo "$cpu_usage >= $CPU_WARNING_THRESHOLD" | bc -l) )); then
            cpu_status="WARNING"
        fi
        
        append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "CPU Usage" "$cpu_usage" "%" "$cpu_status"
        log_info "CPU Usage: ${cpu_usage}% [$cpu_status]"
    fi
    
    # Memory Usage
    if [[ "$ENABLE_MEMORY_MONITORING" == "true" ]]; then
        log_info "Checking memory usage..."
        
        # Parse memory info into variables
        eval "$(get_memory_info)"
        
        local mem_status="OK"
        if (( $(echo "$mem_percent >= $MEMORY_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD" | bc -l) )); then
            mem_status="CRITICAL"
        elif (( $(echo "$mem_percent >= $MEMORY_WARNING_THRESHOLD" | bc -l) )); then
            mem_status="WARNING"
        fi
        
        append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Memory Usage" "$mem_percent" "%" "$mem_status"
        append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Memory Used" "$(echo "scale=2; $mem_used / 1024" | bc)" "MB" "INFO"
        append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Memory Total" "$(echo "scale=2; $mem_total / 1024" | bc)" "MB" "INFO"
        
        log_info "Memory Usage: ${mem_percent}% [$mem_status]"
    fi
    
    # Load Average
    log_info "Checking system load..."
    eval "$(get_load_average)"
    
    local load_status="OK"
    if (( $(echo "$norm_load1 >= 2.0" | bc -l) )); then
        load_status="CRITICAL"
    elif (( $(echo "$norm_load1 >= 1.0" | bc -l) )); then
        load_status="WARNING"
    fi
    
    append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Load Average (1m)" "$load1" "load" "$load_status"
    append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Load Average (5m)" "$load5" "load" "INFO"
    append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Load Average (15m)" "$load15" "load" "INFO"
    
    # System Uptime
    log_info "Checking system uptime..."
    eval "$(get_system_uptime)"
    append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "System Uptime" "$uptime_formatted" "time" "INFO"
    
    # Disk Usage
    if [[ "$ENABLE_DISK_MONITORING" == "true" ]]; then
        log_info "Checking disk usage..."
        
        local disk_data
        local disk_entry=""
        
        while IFS= read -r line; do
            if [[ "$line" == "---" ]]; then
                # Process accumulated disk entry
                if [[ -n "$disk_entry" ]]; then
                    eval "$disk_entry"
                    append_to_report "$report_file" "$output_format" "Disk $mountpoint" "$percent" "%" "$status"
                    log_info "Disk $mountpoint: ${percent}% [$status]"
                fi
                disk_entry=""
            else
                disk_entry+="$line"
                disk_entry+=$'\n'
            fi
        done < <(get_disk_usage)
    fi
    
    # Top Processes
    if [[ "$ENABLE_PROCESS_MONITORING" == "true" ]]; then
        log_info "Getting top processes by CPU..."
        
        local process_count=0
        local process_entry=""
        
        while IFS= read -r line; do
            if [[ "$line" == "---" ]]; then
                if [[ -n "$process_entry" ]]; then
                    eval "$process_entry"
                    ((process_count++))
                    if (( process_count <= 3 )); then  # Show top 3 in log
                        log_info "  PID $pid ($user): CPU ${cpu}% - $command"
                    fi
                fi
                process_entry=""
            else
                process_entry+="$line"
                process_entry+=$'\n'
            fi
        done < <(get_top_processes_by_cpu 5)
    fi
    
    # Service Port Checks
    if [[ "$ENABLE_SERVICE_MONITORING" == "true" ]]; then
        log_info "Checking service ports..."
        
        for service in "${!SERVICE_PORTS[@]}"; do
            local port="${SERVICE_PORTS[$service]}"
            eval "$(check_service_port "$port")"
            
            if [[ "$status" == "LISTENING" ]]; then
                log_success "  Service $service (port $port) is running"
            else
                log_warning "  Service $service (port $port) is not running"
            fi
        done
    fi
    
    # Write report footer
    write_report_footer "$report_file" "$output_format"
    
    log_success "Report saved to: $report_file"
    
    # Display report content for text format
    if [[ "$output_format" == "text" ]]; then
        echo
        echo "=== REPORT CONTENT ==="
        cat "$report_file"
    fi
}

# Command line argument parsing
parse_arguments() {
    local format="$DEFAULT_OUTPUT_FORMAT"
    local action="monitor"
    
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case "$1" in
            --format|-f)
                format="$2"
                shift 2
                ;;
            --list|-l)
                action="list"
                shift
                ;;
            --clean|-c)
                action="clean"
                shift
                ;;
            --archive|-a)
                action="archive"
                shift
                ;;
            --help|-h)
                action="help"
                shift
                ;;
            *)
                log_error "Unknown option: $1"
                action="help"
                shift
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    echo "$action|$format"
}

# Show help
show_help() {
    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    echo
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  -f, --format FORMAT   Output format (text, json, csv). Default: text"
    echo "  -l, --list           List recent reports"
    echo "  -c, --clean          Clean old reports"
    echo "  -a, --archive        Archive existing reports"
    echo "  -h, --help           Show this help message"
    echo
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0                   # Run monitor with text output"
    echo "  $0 -f json           # Run monitor with JSON output"
    echo "  $0 --list            # List recent reports"
    echo "  $0 --clean           # Clean old reports"
}

# Main execution
echo
log_info "=== SYSTEM MONITORING STARTED ==="

# Parse command line arguments
IFS='|' read -r action format <<< "$(parse_arguments "$@")"

# Execute requested action
case "$action" in
    "monitor")
        run_system_monitor "$format"
        ;;
    "list")
        list_reports
        ;;
    "clean")
        clean_old_reports
        ;;
    "archive")
        archive_reports
        ;;
    "help")
        show_help
        ;;
esac

echo
log_success "=== MONITORING COMPLETED ==="
echo
echo "âœ… Multi-file Bash application demo completed!"
echo
echo "ðŸ”„ All scripts persist within this container session"
echo "ðŸ—‘ï¸  Files will be cleaned up when container restarts"
echo "ðŸ”’ Host system remains completely isolated"
echo
echo "ðŸ“Š This demo showed:"
echo "   - Function libraries and sourcing"
echo "   - Configuration management"
echo "   - Service-oriented architecture"
echo "   - Arrays and associative arrays"
echo "   - String manipulation and formatting"
echo "   - File operations and reporting"
echo "   - Process monitoring and management"
echo "   - Error handling with traps"
echo "   - Command substitution and pipes"
echo "   - Advanced Bash scripting patterns"
